item.title: R to @triple5guy: oh it's still totally terrifying. but the Robesons are completely ridiculous people, perfect parodies of Republicans -- though their ridiculousness never undercuts how monstrous and scary they are.
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: oh it's still totally terrifying. but the Robesons are completely ridiculous people, perfect parodies of Republicans -- though their ridiculousness never undercuts how monstrous and scary they are.

item.title: wish I could trick some outlet into letting me write about Captain Hastings' beloved Lagonda from the old episodes of Agatha Christie's Poirot

item.title: R to @NotA_Doctor: not just me, according to pretty much everyone. it's a meta slasher/horror film that reinvented, deconstructed, and satirized the genre
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: not just me, according to pretty much everyone. it's a meta slasher/horror film that reinvented, deconstructed, and satirized the genre

item.title: R to @Charles75978018: comedy in the film was intentional. a pretty major aspect of Stuart Gordon's work in general.
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: comedy in the film was intentional. a pretty major aspect of Stuart Gordon's work in general.

item.title: R to @triple5guy: satirical comedy, sure. it lampoons Reagan & his supporters with its villains, the Robesons.
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: satirical comedy, sure. it lampoons Reagan & his supporters with its villains, the Robesons.

item.title: R to @McLeemz: highly recommend it. talking about the shit I love on here is a lot more fun for everyone, and it gets me roasted/dunked on/dragged much less often
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: highly recommend it. talking about the shit I love on here is a lot more fun for everyone, and it gets me roasted/dunked on/dragged much less often

item.title: R to @MichaelBruesh: I mean, yeah. a dark comedy. with those villains... it's a satirical take on Reaganism.

item.title: R to @Grief_Eater: I just don't understand how you write off all those great movies because they didn't scare you personally!
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: I just don't understand how you write off all those great movies because they didn't scare you personally!

item.title: R to @CelluloidWhisky: I love horror movies but I'm rarely scared by them. so by that guy's definition, most horror movies are not only bad but not actually horror movies -- which is deeply, deeply ridiculous
item.dc:creator: @BBW_BFF
item.description: I love horror movies but I'm rarely scared by them. so by that guy's definition, most horror movies are not only bad but not actually horror movies -- which is deeply, deeply ridiculous
